Replies.Reply: With every sun comes a new day. A new beginning. A hope that things will be better today than they were yesterday.
But not for me. My name's Eep. This, is my family, the Croods. If you weren't clued in already by the animal skins and sloping foreheads - we're cavemen. Most days we spend in our cave, in the dark.

We were the last ones around. There used to be neighbors. The Gorts, smashed by a mammoth. The Horks, swallowed by a sand snake. The Erfs, mosquito bite. Throgs, common cold. And, the Croods. That's us. The Croods made it...
Because of my Dad. He was strong... and he followed the rules.
... the ones painted on the cave walls.
But this is a story about how all that changed in an instant.
Because what we didn't know, was that our world was about to come to an end. And there were no rules on our cave walls to prepare us for that.
We've been in that cave forever.
I was watching. I was fine.
What's the point of all this?
I mean, why are we here? What are we doing this for?
I haven't played with that thing in years.
Quiet! I'm not supposed to be out here.
No! It's mine. No, no. I caught it!
It does what you tell it?
But you said it was dying.
It comes from where you come from?
Are you dead? Can I have your fire if you're dead?
Nothing. I left on my own.
You'll never believe it. I found something new.
Oh. Well, I thought he was a warthog, but then he turned into a boy.
There was a boy. Watch, okay. I'm gonna call him.
It was beautiful. You want to see dangerous? Here.
What!? You can't keep me inside forever!
You really need to see this...
Grug pushes Eep aside and shows Guy his threat display.
It doesn't come out of him.
Yeah. But I won't let him.
They're not so scary once you get to know them.
That already happened. It destroyed our cave.
We can't let him go! What if we don't find a cave before sunset? What if it takes a few days? What if the birds come back?
Dad really has his heart set on a cave.
No no, it's okay Sandy. That's just a belt.
Isn't this fun? We're taking our first trip together.
Stop shoving, or I will pull out your tongue!
Dad, can I take a turn carrying him?
You have bug for dinner. Plenty of bug!
How long have you been alone?
Just move your arm... no, your other arm.
Uh... It didn't step in your trap-y, thing.
We never have that much food.
Hey, do you have a minute? How did the tiger fly?
Hey Thunk, you have a spider on your face.
Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhh! I love them! Where are my feet!?
Oh dad, you say that about everything.
You have to stop worrying for all of us.
The rules don't work out here.
That wasn't living, that was just, not dying. There's a difference.
We would be dead if we listened you.
We have to follow Guy now.
No. I have too much to say to you. I need to fix everything and I don't have time.
This works good. What do you call it?
I never got to tell him.
You really need to see this.
This is me. My name's Eep. And this, is my family. The Croods. If you weren't clued in by the sun tans and pets, we're not exactly cavemen anymore.
Our world is still plenty harsh and hostile. But now we know the Croods will make it.
Because we changed the rules. The ones that kept us in the dark.
And because of my dad, who taught us that anyone can change...
So from now on we'll stay out here.
Where we can follow the light.
You're supposed to wait for my signal Eep. Eep?
Eep would you come down here? You're being so dramatic.
No, no, no Sandy, come back here.
No, I mean, you're already out now.
Never mind, Thunk. Just, come out.
The signal isn't so you know it's me, it's so you know I wasn't eaten by an animal.
I want to see some real caveman action out there. We do this fast. We do this loud, we do this as a family and never not be afraid. Go!
Ok. Thunk. Go. Come on Thunk.
Hah! Way to go. Take it to the cave!
Just wait till we get home. Eep put on the brakes.
Here you go, Thunk. Drink up.
That's alright. I ate last week.
Come on, come on. Darkness brings death!
How can she not like the cave? It's so cozy.
Come on, I gotta close the cave...
What were you doing up there, Eep?
Well then why did you go up there?
Why don't you know? Stop looking for things. Fear keeps us alive Eep. Never not be afraid.
No one said survival was fun.
Hmm? Would you come down here. Eep?
I just don't see why she needs her own ledge. That's all. That's what this is about.
What things? How long is this going to take? Really? I mean she already doesn't listen to me.
If she wants to survive, she has to follow our rules.
That's a good idea ... How about a story, huh?
Ok. Can I borrow that? Thank you. Eep!
Tonight we'll hear the story of Krispy Bear.

A long time ago, this little bear was alive. She was alive because she listened to her father and lived her life in routine and darkness and terror. So she was happy. But Krispy had one, terrible problem. She was filled with...
Yes. And one day, while she was in a tree, the curious little bear wanted to climb to the top.
And no sooner than she climbed to the top, she saw something new and died.
Yes! Her last moments of terror still frozen on her face.
Are you hurt? What took you?
You know what, I am so mad right now, that I can't talk to her.
Okay Eep, that's it. We're going back to the cave and you're going to stay in there until you're older than... her!
No. No one is going anywhere.
What else did that boy say?
I don't know, I'm not sure. Down. In a lower place. One thing's for sure, we can't go back the way we came.
We can't be out in the open like this.
Okay. Stay quiet. Hopefully nothing big knows we're here yet.
Wait. Okay. Wait. Okay. Wait. Okay.
That's right! You can't get past this!
Come on! Hurry up, let's go! Come on!
Okay, that's one, two, three, four, five... six...
Whoa! Stay back. We don't know what it wants.
Now we'll all sit here, and wait for the sun to come back. And tomorrow we'll find a new cave, and pretend today never happened.
Eep, don't touch him. Goodness knows where he's been.
Sandy! No! Fire is not a play thing!
Thunk! Uh, try hiding from it in the tall dry grass!
Fine. You're staying with us till we find a cave.
I've made a decision. We're going to, that mountain! Don't ask me why. It's just a hunch. It just feels right.
Oh come on, just think. Our whole family, packed together on a long, slow trip across country? Days and nights with just each other. We'll tell stories. We'll laugh.
We'll become closer as a family.
Do you want me to turn this family around? Do you?! Because I will turn this family around so fast!
Come on, you can hold it.
Go behind one of those lumpy things and make it fast.
I can do this all day long. No, no, no, and still no.
We'll eat when we get there.
No man should have a pet. It's weird, and wrong. It's--
Alright, show me your hunting face.
Hold her still. Use a rock. Ugga would you just hit her legs.
That's a good idea. How about a story huh?
Once upon a time there was a little tiger who lived in a cave with her family.
I know! But, while everyone was asleep, she went out anyway.
Yes! And no sooner than she did, her cave was destroyed and everyone had to go on this long, sucky walk, with some weirdo they met, and died! The end.
Tomorrow isn't a place, you can't see it!
Well, WE are going to shut our eyes and sleep. And when we wake up we're going to find the place that has everything we want.
I was watching. We were fine.
Aaaaahhhhhh! Do not step on those weird, pointy rocks!
Hello? Nobody's listening! No one is listening. You cannot walk on those!
We've gotten along just fine without brains till now. Cavemen don't need brains. We have these. Heeya! Haha!
That's what I'm talking about! Ideas are for weaklings.
Now, let's get to that mountain.
Augh! No no no! Not cool. Not cool.
Okay. Okay. That's enough. I don't see why the kids need their own shells.
Wait-- you're saying we should split up?
No no no no no. It's my job to keep you safe. I'm still in charge and we are not splitting up.
Except for you two. And that's final.
Stay where you are. I'll find you.
thank you for bringing me that interesting Guy update!
Sleep pile? How about a story, huh?
Yeah, Wow. Like, I was up all night cuz like all these, ideas just kept coming to me.
Belt! New and improved! It's even self-
I call it a "rug." Rhymes with Grug.
It's gonna get us places faster than shoes.
Painting is a thing of the past. I call this, a "snap-shot."
Since I don't have a brain, they're coming from my stomach. Down deep below, and then up again into my mind.
See, I got ideas, I got thoughts.
Like this. I call it a "mobile home."
And I'm calling this one a "lifterator."
I thought if I could have ideas like Guy, maybe Eep would listen to me. Maybe she wouldn't want to go with Guy.
And I also thought it would kill your mother. So you know? Win win.
Cave! Everyone inside. Come on! Hurry up, let's go. Go, go.
Wait, so you're all going to do this?
It's my job to worry. It's my job to follow the rules.
Ugga, everyone, you have to listen to me.
Big words anger me. Keep talking.
Hnnnnnngh! No. What is this stuff that saves you from my punches?
No. I have to get back to them.
You followed the light. My daughter is a lot like you.
I guess I was just busy keeping them all alive.
That's right... but we can't do that from here. We need one of your ideas.
Come on. You can do it.
Scared? I'll show you scared. Hand me those acting sticks!
No more dark. No more hiding. No more caves.
What's the point of all this?
I can't change. I don't have ideas. But I have my strength. And right now that's all you need.
You know, I've wanted to throw you away ever since I met you.
When you make it, so will I.
I was thinking of calling it a Hug.
Because it rhymes with Grug. But you can change it if you want.
Ahhhh! Back! Stay back! Stay back!
They're in trouble. Hang on! I'm coming.
How do I get across? Gotta think. What would Guy do? What would Guy do?
Ahhh! Where's the danger? Who blew their shell?
One, two, three, four, five, six...
Well, a boys gotta have a pet.
Turns out, I'm a cat person.
As soon as I get Sandy, I'll go back in, and you can give the signal.
Get um Mom! Do it for the Croods!
Come on Croods. Go, go, go.
The moon is full. Bath night.
Whack! Like she's cleaning a rug, Ugga SMACKS Sandy hard with the stick. Dust and bugs fly off of her.
You know she hates the cave, Grug.
It is a little, dark, Grug.
She's working through some things and needs her own space.
How about a story? Eep loves those.
Alright, everyone sharpen your teeth and let's pile up.
Eep. Stay inside the family kill circle.
Yes. Grug, the cave, it's gone.
Grug, when you're done, we should get going.
Aww, what a cute little guy.
Oh, I'm sorry. We're the Croooooods!
I don't know Grug. We've never really walked that far.
If you're not ready to challenge her, then don't look her in the eye.
No more touching. No more touching.
Maybe we should have stopped for water.
You're too skinny. If she was gonna eat anyone it would be--
Grug, they're okay. Guy's with them.
Oh, okay. I'm gonna go up and why don't you join us when you stop being a big drag!
I know it was hard for you to bring us along, but they had the best day of their lives... Thank you for that.
No, that's not true. What about that one time when he a...
What is that on your head?
What are you trying to do Grug?
Oh Grug, is that what this is all about?
We have to go back to the cave. Hurry, hurry, stay together. Let's keep moving.
Grug? What's wrong with you? Grug we'll die if we stay here!
Grug. Listen to me. We've gotta get back to that cave.
No. We don't know what's over there.
He made it... He made it...
I am waiting for the signal, dad.
Uhh, but if you don't give the signal, how do I know you're my dad?
Then why is the signal an animal noise?
I don't know... I'm still waiting for the signal.
Oh hey Dad, can we eat now?
Oh yeah, tell us a story.
I get it, dad. I get it. I will never do anything new or different.
Eep's got a boy hog! Eep's got a boy hog!
So Dad, just to be clear, are we looking for the exact same cave?
If it was me, I'm just throwing this out there, if it was me choosing the cave, I would go with a smaller cave.
got em-- Now they're really hitting you.
Hey look! This cave has a tongue.
Hah! It's scared of the dark... wait...
Ah, the sun is in his hands!
Ow! You're not my friend. Stop, stop touching me!
Stop please, please. I'm only nine.
Wow! Looks like magic. And smells like food.
Mom? Did you hear that? I can get my own stick!
I don't think my feet can do that.
Aaaaaaaaugh. Get her off. Get off.
I'm pretty dizzy, so I'm just going to lay down for a minute.
Get it off! You stay away from me.
You've got a ton of eggs. Just make another egg!
Now you're just rubbing it in.
You know, we lost him. But when the bird stepped on me and pushed me into the ground, the scorpion grabbed a hold of me and one thing led to another and here we are eating him. Win win.
Someone get a stick! Get her off!
Oh you sick old monster! Hurry! Put the stick in her mouth!
Ahhh! They're all over me... Tell my story...
Yeah a story, tell us a story!
Yes! Two stories in one night!
You mean these rocks? Ahh owww! Do not step on these rocks!
Ow! Jumping doesn't help, I mean, just briefly, but it doesn't get better! Ow!
Dad. I don't have a brain.
Good fish. Don't eat my feet.
Dad? I'm freaking out a little bit.
It's gonna be okay. I'm gonna pass out.
Good boy. Whose my good boy? You need a name, you want a name? I'm going to call you - Douglas. Look at him. Can you do tricks? Roll over. Come on Douglas, roll over.
More suns in the sky than you can count.
Hey wait. Let's ask that ugly lady if she's seen dad.
I wish I had a ride.
Let's do it again. I think I blinked.
The sun doesn't hurt my eyes anymore!
Wow, you sound just like him.
Let's do that again. I think I blinked.
Old lady down! Eep, avenge me.
I don't want to lose my protective layer.
And seven... if we're counting Chunky the Death Cat.
I'll never live long enough to get there.
Could you keep your big giant arms on your side of the trail!
I'm not dying on an empty stomach.
It's taking too long! I'm grabbing a snack.
Angry girl wants to be doing what they're doing.
Not enough. Not enough. I need more. I need more!
Well, there goes our chance for survival.
These shoes are great! Where do you get these ideas?
Last week, haha. That's a funny story!
I was in love once. He was a hunter, I was a gatherer. It was quite a scandal.
Then my father smashed him with a rock and traded me to your Grandfather.
And then Torg said "Know it? I drew it!"
Well, that makes one of us. Count me in!
Grug has no idea how to protect us. In fact, he has no ideas at all.
Face it! If he actually had an idea of his own I'd, I'd have a heart attack and die!
I almost feel sorry for him.
We're gonna jump on the sun and ride it to Tomorrow with Guy.
Wait. You surprised me today. Lunkhead.
DRIBBLING the egg down-range with her cane like a hockey player. LIYOTES POP UP from behind hoodoos. They SWARM in behind her.
Crouched in the shade of a scrubby bush, like a runner on the blocks - she has the Liyotes in her sights. Eep LAUNCHES.
Standing at the edge of the cliff alone, BLOWING her shell horn. Behind her, Sandy HOWLS. Gran puts a comforting arm around her grandchildren, even she has a tear in her eye.
Okay, could you not, hee hee hee, that tickles. Hey!
It's dying. I can fix it!
Ow. Okay, it doesn't come out of me.
I concur. Tiger girl, we need to leave immediately.
And this is Belt. Cook, conversationalist, navigator, also keeps my pants up.
Let me clarify, Eep. The world is ending.
I've seen it. It's coming this way.
We've got to get to high ground. I know a mountain, that way--
Okay. Here. If you survive, call me.
Cavemen! Stand back! They're practically animals. See their bony, sloping foreheads?
The excessive body hair? Oh, that one's got a tail...
Close your eyes. I'm going to have to take their lives.
You know, you're a lot like your daughter.
So, your Dad, he's trying to kill me.
The mountain? High ground? End of the world, remember?
Noooo. That was just the beginning of the end. The end of the end is still coming.
What? No I'm not. Don't make me part of this. Stay here if you want, but let me go. I've got a dream, a mission, a reason to live.
Umm... I've got an idea. Let's go to that mountain.
Uh, there, are, caves on that mountain.
It's a mountain. Mountains are safe.
Yes. Sticks. Caves and sticks. Crazy sticks. Let's go.
No. No. No. Don't do that. He will cut you. That's not food, he's a pet. My pet.
An animal that you don't eat.
No seriously, what are they doing?
What happened to the egg and the bird?
Oh, look at that. She's not gonna eat me right?
Owww! I just want something to eat.
Please... I'll let you help me hunt.
soft whistle Raargh, Thump thump thump, thubububububub soft whistle poom!
Looks like we won't be having any leftovers.
You know, when you have so much food to eat you have some, left over.
Whoa! I did not see that coming. Twist ending. My stories never end like that.
Okay. But it won't be as good as Grug's.

But when no one was looking, she would go near the cliff, for the closer she came to the edge, the more she could hear, the more she could see, the more she could feel. Finally, she stood at the very edge, and she saw a light. She leaned out to touch it, and slipped.
A place with more suns in the sky than you can count.
A place not like today, or yesterday, a place where things are better.
Oh yes, yes it is. I've seen it. That's where I'm going.
That was too close. It almost caught us.
We've got to move faster. Do you people have any other speed aside from "wander?"
I only share when I'm outside the log.
I can help you, but we're going to have to make a few changes around here. The log ride is over. Drop the log.
Okay! She's up. I'm good. We're good...
I'm calling it, a brain. I'm pretty sure it's where ideas come from.
He jumped on the sun and rode it to tomorrow.
So the bear says, "Your cave?" I've been dumping my bones here since last week.
It's not a story! It's a joke.
You know, just making something up... to make you laugh.
Here you go, one for you, and this ones for you.
So if anyone gets in trouble, we can call the others.
We can try more paths at once. It's the fastest way through.
No. Too slow. Everybody, keep moving forward and we'll get out.
I want to show you something.
Every sun that crosses our sky, comes to rest up there.
He's a big guy. How can he just disappear like that?
Grug. We have to keep moving.
This is pointless. We're running out of time. Everything is collapsing. You're being irrational and counterproductive.
Remember how you were this morning? You changed, remember? Idea man? Modern man?
Please Grug. You have to stop struggling.
No one gets out of this. Believe me. I know.
I was little when it happened. The last thing my parents told me was, "Don't hide. Live. Follow the Sun. You'll make it to Tomorrow."
No. She's like you. She loves you but always forgets to say it. Just like you forget to tell her.
It's okay. That's what Dads do.
Yeah, I know. But he's doing the best with what he has. Let's go.
There he is. Belt, I want romance, drama, sincerity. Move me.
That's our cue. Now work it!
He's not coming over. I don't think our puppet looks scared enough.
Hurry! Come on. We're gonna make it!
There it is. The sun. We can do it! We can ride it to Tomorrow.
I don't understand. The sun was right here. It was right here.
He's riding the Sun... but not very well.
Leaning against a rock next to Gran, Sandy, Eep and Ugga.
SLAPPED on a rock in front of the Croods.
His face SLATHERED with reddish mud.
Ugga and Grug approach. They hear the LAUGHING coming from high above. Grug peers up and sees the SWINGING HAMMOCKS, torch lights.
Thunk, Sandy Belt and Gran are sitting around a torch, listening to one of Gran's stories.
Ha ha ha ha ha ha.
Standing on one side of a primitive Teeter-Totter.
Burned and battered, laying in the bottom of a turtle shell boat.
Belt and Sandy poke their heads up at the base of the screen.
